# Debugging

[Burke Holland course github](https://burkeholland.gitbook.io/vs-code-can-do-that/)
[Vs Code refactoring docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/refactoring)

The terminology and the concepts sometimes seems to be hard to get it,
but the hardest part of debugging any application is just 
**Getting the configuration right for the application to run.**

In Javascript, there is no configuration required debugging javascript files.

VS Code comes by default with the Node debugger and the Chrome plugin is an extension of that.

## 1.Breakpoints and log points

1.Add a breakpoint on the left side
2.Run the file on `f5` command || the *PLAY button in the sidebar debugger section.*
or with Node.js or with the Chrome extension

On left side of the code section,
Hit a right click then choose
"add a log point":

<br>
<br>
